item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "I was heading to Nebraska. Now there's a sentence you don't want to say too often if you can possibly help it." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Alexandra Fuller
item.description: "Cowboy up, cupcake." -- Alexandra Fuller

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Eric Weiner
item.description: "Money matters but less than we think and not in the way that we think. Family is important. So are friends. Envy is toxic. So is excessive thinking. Beaches are optional. Trust is not. Neither is gratitude." -- Eric Weiner

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "I'm telling you, it's fu**ing hard to be classy" -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I'll think of it tomorrow, at Tara. I can stand it then. Tomorrow, I'll think of some way to get him back. After all, tomorrow is another day." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "American history is a quagmire, and the more one knows, the quaggier the mire gets." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "That's what we Americans do when we find a place that's really special. We go there and act exactly like ourselves. And we are a bunch of fun-loving dopes." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Nancy Mitford
item.description: "I love children, especially when they cry, for then someone takes them away." -- Nancy Mitford

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Dorothy L. Sayers
item.description: "Even idiots ocasionally speak the truth accidentally." -- Dorothy L. Sayers

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Life starts all over again when it gets crisp in the fall." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I cannot fix on the hour, or the spot, or the look or the words, which laid the foundation. It is too long ago. I was in the middle before I knew that I had begun." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "When you take risks you learn that there will be times when you succeed and there will be times when you fail, and both are equally important." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Kennedy add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough" -- Stephen Chbosky
